question:
Year: 1919
Main Idea: Ended WWI Between Allies/Germany
Notes: Paris Peace Conference, Big 4 (Woodrow Wilson, David Lloyd George, Georges Clemenceau, Vittorio Orlando), Wilson's 14 Points, League of Nations

Year: 1713
Main Idea: Mostly Ended Wars of Spanish Succession
Notes: France/Spain vs. Britain/Savoy/United Provinces (Netherlands), Phillip (Duke of Anjou Bourbon) named to Spanish throne - ended Hapsburg control

Year: 1814
Main Idea: Ended War of 1812 Between US/Britain
Notes: Due to distance, did not stop Battle of New Orleans 2 weeks later, minimal effect - both just wanted peace

Year: 1905
Main Idea: Ended Russo-Japanese War
Notes: Brokered by Teddy Roosevelt in Maine naval shipyard, won him the Nobel Peace Prize

Year: 1819
Main Idea: Spain Sold Florida to the US
Notes: US/Spain land dispute after the Louisiana Purchase, negotiated by Secretary of State John Quincy Adams

Year: 1978
Main Idea: Normalized Relations Between Egypt/Israel
Notes: Brokered by Jimmy Carter between Anwar Sadat and Menachem Begin, returned Sinai Peninsula to Egypt, Israeli access to Red Sea/Suez Canal, isolated Egypt, Sadat assassinated 1981

Year: 1848
Main Idea: Ended Mexican-American War
Notes: Signed in Mexico City, Mexican Cessation - CA/NV/UT to the US, named Rio Grande border between Texas and Mexico

Year: 1918
Main Idea: Separate Peace Between USSR Bolsheviks/Germany
Notes: Peace to focus on defeating Whites in Russian Civil War, ceded Ukraine/Belarus/Baltics, negotiated by Leon Trotsky, nullified by subsequent Treaty of Versailles

Year: 1494
Main Idea: Divided New World Between Spain/Portugal
Notes: Bull by Pope Alexander VI (Spanish), Portugal gets east of Cape Verde Islands (Brazil) and Spain get west

Year: 1648
Main Idea: Ended Thirty Years' War
Notes: Holy Roman Empire/Germany states/Spain/France/Sweden/Dutch Republic, ruler's religion = country's, Peace of Augsburg, religious tolerance (for Christians)

Year: 1949
Main Idea: Created Indepdendent Vatican City
Notes: Catholicism becomes state religion of Italy (until 1984), signed by Benito Mussolini and Pope Pius XI's representative, ended "Roman Question"

Year: 1898
Main Idea: Ended Spanish-American War
Notes: Transferred Guam/Puerto Rico/Philippines to US, made Cuba ostensibly independent, began American imperialism overseas
